quoteLast: yesterday afternoon, were few and simple. He doubled Mr. Kilburn up, after the fashion of an ordinary jack-knife, and placed him in the barrel, wedge-extremity first, remarking, as he did so, “She is, is she?” He then rammed Mr. Kilburn carefully home, and put the cover on.
title: In Partnership: Studies in story-telling

quoteFirst: The moment of the occurrence of new moon in May 120 was
quoteLast: on the morning of Thursday, May 17. We do not know whether Nuniz ascertained his facts from native almanacks or the calculations of the astrologers, or whether he spoke from observations made by himself or by some one who was present; but Nuniz was an ordinary person, not a skilled astronomer, so far as we can tell, and he may well have called the day on which the crescent of the new moon first made its appearance just after sunset the "new moon day.
title: A Forgotten Empire (Vijayanagar): A Contribution to the History of India
author: Sewell, Robert, 1845-1925; Nunes, Fernão, active 16th century; Paes, Domingos, active 16th century

quoteFirst: The end was now at hand, and he died at
quoteLast: in the morning of May 27, 1865.  The window was open.  The sky was beginning to grow grey, a few rooks had cawed, the swallows were twittering, the landrail was craking from the Ox-close, and a favourite cock, which he used to call his morning gun, leaped out from some hollies, and gave his accustomed crow.  The ear of his master was deaf to the call.
title: Wanderings in South America
author: Waterton, Charles, 1782-1865; Moore, Norman, 1847-1922 [Author of introduction, etc.]

quoteFirst: With Mariner slowly tumbling in free space, it was now necessary to initiate a series of events to place the spacecraft in the proper flight position. At
quoteLast: , 44 minutes after launch, the Mariner Central Computer and Sequencer (CC&S) on board the spacecraft issued a command for explosively activated pin pullers to release the solar panels and the radiometer dish from their launch-secured positions. At 2:53, 60 minutes after liftoff, the attitude control system was turned on and the Sun orientation sequence began with the extension of the directional antenna to a preset angle of 72 degrees.
title: Mariner Mission to Venus
author: Jet Propulsion Laboratory (U.S.)
